hints.content:
Multiplication and division are related:

$\begin{align}
\greenD{\text{number of groups}} \times \maroonD{\text{size of groups}} = \purpleC{\text{total}} \\\\
\maroonD{\text{size of groups}} \times \greenD{\text{number of groups}} = \purpleC{\text{total}} \\\\
\\\\
\purpleC{\text{total}} \div \greenD{\text{number of groups}} =\maroonD{\text{size of groups}} \\\\
\purpleC{\text{total}} \div \maroonD{\text{size of groups}} =\greenD{\text{number of groups}}
\end{align}$

In this fact family, the $\purpleC{\text{total}}$ is $\purpleC{56}$.

The $\greenD{\text{number of the groups}}$ is $\greenD{8}$.

![Tape diagram showing 56 is equal to 8 equal groups of question mark](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/429851e12ae5d58629e2815b7a9277c9dc0390bd)

The $\maroonD{\text{size of the groups}}$ is ${\maroonD{?}}$.
The equation $\purpleC{56} = \greenD{8} \times {\maroonD{?}}$ can help us find the unknown number.

question.content:
**Create an equation to help us find the unknown number in $8 = 56 \div {?}$ .**

[[☃ dropdown 7]] $= 8\times{}$ [[☃ dropdown 4]]
